column2: Maintenance of Lost Weight and Long-Term Management of Obesity
column5: Covers the entire weight management lifecycle, including safe loss rates, plateaus, and maintenance.

column2: "Calories in, calories out" and macronutrient intake...
column5: Explains the core science of energy balance with nuance, addressing the "calories in, calories out" debate.
Provides expert, evidence-based summaries and comparisons of all major diets (Keto, Paleo, etc.).
Explains the importance of protein for health, satiety, and weight management in a public-facing format.

column2: Physical Activity Guidelines for Americans, 2nd edition
column5: The definitive U.S. source on exercise recommendations, answering the "how much exercise" question.

column2: The Role of Exercise and Physical Activity in Weight Loss and Maintenance
column5: Explains the mechanisms of how exercise contributes to weight loss and its crucial role in maintenance.

column2: Psychological and behavioral correlates of weight loss and maintenance
column5: Analyzes the specific psychological skills (e.g., motivation, coping) proven to lead to long-term success.

column2: Clinical Guidelines on the Identification, Evaluation, and Treatment of Overweight and Obesity in Adults
column5: The foundational U.S. clinical guidelines covering all aspects of obesity treatment, from assessment to behavior.

column2: Short sleep duration and weight gain: a systematic review
column5: Details the powerful link between sleep and weight, including the disruptive hormonal pathways.

column2: Effectiveness of diet and physical activity interventions for ethnic minority groups
column5: Analyzes what makes weight management interventions effective across a wide range of minority populations.

column2: Physiological adaptations to weight loss and factors favouring weight regain
column5: Explains the biological reasons for the weight loss plateau, including metabolic, hormonal, and brain adaptations.

column2: Is a calorie a calorie? The role of diet composition in satiety
column5: Explains why food quality is as important as quantity, focusing on how different foods affect hunger.
